title: Tailwind CSS Basic Concepts
description: Flashcards covering basic concepts and setup of Tailwind CSS.

cards.a: Tailwind CSS is a utility-first CSS framework for rapidly building custom user interfaces.

cards.q: How does Tailwind CSS differ from traditional CSS?
cards.a: Instead of writing CSS rules, Tailwind provides utility classes that apply specific styles directly in HTML.
A utility class is a single-purpose class that applies one specific style attribute.

cards.q: How is styling applied using Tailwind?
cards.a: By adding utility classes in the HTML elements' class attribute.

cards.q: What is the default Tailwind configuration file?
What is JIT mode in Tailwind?
cards.a: Just-In-Time mode generates styles as they are needed for faster builds and smaller CSS files.
You can install Tailwind via npm or yarn and set it up with PostCSS or frameworks like Next.js.

cards.q: How to include Tailwind in a project?
cards.a: Typically by importing Tailwind directives in your CSS file: @tailwind base; @tailwind components; @tailwind utilities;
PurgeCSS removes unused styles from the final CSS build to reduce file size.

cards.q: How to customize colors in Tailwind?
cards.a: By extending the colors section in tailwind.config.js.
